QuestionStatement: Which of the following is an example of fiscal policy?
AnswerChoices: Increasing government expenditures to build highways
Increasing the money supply to increase income
Decreasing the discount rate to lower unemployment and inflation
Decreasing the federal funds rate to stimulate investment
Decreasing the reserve ratio to increase bank reserves

QuestionStatement: Aggregate demand may be measured by adding
AnswerChoices: Consumption, investment, savings, and imports
Savings, government spending, and business inventories
Consumption, investment, government spending, and net exports
Domestic private expenditures and government spending
Domestic expenditures and imports

QuestionStatement: According to the short-run Phillips curve, a decrease in unemployment is expected to be accompanied by
AnswerChoices: Higher labor force participation
An increase in inflation
An increase in the productivity of capital
An increase in the government deficit
A decrease in real gross domestic product

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true about the national debt of the United States?
AnswerChoices: It is the debt owed to foreign investors
It is the accumulation of past and current budget deficits and surpluses
It increases when gross domestic product increases
It increases when exports decrease, and decreases when exports increase
It did not exist before 1980

QuestionStatement: If marginal business tax rates are decreased, how will aggregate supply and employment change in the long run?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E

QuestionStatement: Crowding out occurs when
AnswerChoices: Increases in government spending become ineffective because tax revenues increase as income increases
Government borrowing to finance its spending decreases private sector investment
Monetary policy actions decrease the effectiveness of fiscal policy
Restrictive monetary policy causes the interest rate to increase
Government spending and private sector spending increase by the same percentage rate

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true of a horizontal aggregate supply curve?
AnswerChoices: It is the usual assumption made by classical economists analyzing the long run
It suggests that increases in output can occur without increases in price levels
It suggests that a shift in the aggregate demand curve will lead to a change in the price level
It is likely to occur only in highly industrialized economies
It cannot shift, therefore output remains constant

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will most likely occur if a government adopts an annually balanced budget rule that requires the government to eliminate any deficits or surpluses?
AnswerChoices: Unemployment will be eliminated and prices will be stable
The national debt will increase
Business cycles will become more stable
The automatic stabilizing effect of fiscal policy will be eliminated
The government will be forced to spend less when there are surpluses

QuestionStatement: Which of the following changes would cause an economy’s aggregate demand curve to shift to the right?
AnswerChoices: An increase in spending on imports
An increase in autonomous consumption spending
An increase in interest rates
A decrease in the money supply
A decrease in the overall price level in the economy

QuestionStatement: Which of the following statements concerning economic growth is true?
AnswerChoices: If the population is growing faster than potential output, real gross domestic product per capita will definitely increase
With long-run economic growth, there is an increase in aggregate supply
The gap between rich and poor must widen with long-run economic growth
Increasing potential output necessarily increases the economic welfare of the average citizen
Long-run economic growth is possible with demand management policies

QuestionStatement: If the economy was in a severe recession, the most expansionary fiscal policy would be to
AnswerChoices: Decrease both personal income taxes and government spending by equal amounts
Decrease both the reserve requirement and government spending by the same proportion
Decrease personal income taxes and increase government spending by equal amounts
Increase the money supply and increase government spending by the same proportion
Increase social security taxes and increase government spending by equal amounts

QuestionStatement: Which of the following would most likely stimulate economic growth?
AnswerChoices: Decreased savings
Decreased wages
Increased transfer payments
Increased personal income taxes
Technological progress

QuestionStatement: A decrease in the prices of inputs will cause which of the following to occur in the short run?
AnswerChoices: An increase in the aggregate demand and an increase in the price level
A decrease in the aggregate demand and an increase in the price level
An increase in the short-run aggregate supply and a decrease in the price level
An increase in the short-run aggregate supply and an increase in the price level
A decrease in the short-run aggregate supply and a decrease in the price level

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true of the long-run Phillips curve?
AnswerChoices: It shows there is a trade-off between unemployment and inflation
It is positively sloped when the inflation rate exceeds the unemployment rate
It is vertical at the natural rate of unemployment
It shifts to the right if aggregate demand increases
It is created by an adverse supply shock

QuestionStatement: The graph above shows the macroeconomic conditions of Wattsonia.  Many economists estimate that the natural rate of unemployment is 6 percent.  If this is true and the current rate of unemployment is 5.1 percent, in what range of real gross domestic product is the economy currently producing?
AnswerChoices: Less than Y
At Y
At Y
Greater than Y
and less than Y
Greater than Y

QuestionStatement: Which of the following changes will have the smallest expansionary effect on aggregate demand in the short run?
AnswerChoices: An increase in exports of $100
An increase in government spending of $100
A decrease in taxes of $100
A decrease in imports of $100
A decrease in savings of $100

QuestionStatement: A leftward shift of the long-run aggregate supply curve is most likely consistent with an improvement in a country’s standard of living if
AnswerChoices: Prices fall
Depreciation increases
Population decreases
Taxes decrease
Imports decline

QuestionStatement: Stagflation is caused by
AnswerChoices: An increase in imports
An increase in aggregate demand
A decrease in aggregate demand
A decrease in aggregate supply
An increase in aggregate supply

QuestionStatement: The economy of a country is currently in equilibrium at point A in the diagram above.  If the government does nothing and wages are flexible, which of the following will most likely occur in the long run?
AnswerChoices: Falling wages will shift the aggregate demand curve to the right, producing full employment
Rising wages will shift the aggregate demand curve to the right, producing full employment
The economy will remain at point A
Rising wages will shift the aggregate supply curve to the right, producing full employment
Falling wages will shift the aggregate supply curve to the right, producing full employment

QuestionStatement: A country’s government runs a budget deficit when which of the following occurs in a given year?
AnswerChoices: The amount of new loans to developing nations exceeds the amount of loans paid off by developing nations.
Government spending exceeds tax revenues
The debt owed to foreigners exceeds the debt owed to the country’s citizens
The amount of borrowed exceeds the interest payment on the national debt
Interest payments on the national debt exceed spending on goods and services

QuestionStatement: A high marginal propensity to consume implies which of the following?
AnswerChoices: A small change in consumption when income changes
A high savings rate
A high marginal tax rate
An equilibrium level of income near full employment
A low marginal propensity to save

QuestionStatement: All of the following will shift the investment demand curve to the right EXCEPT
AnswerChoices: A decrease in the corporate income tax rate
An increase in the productivity of new capital goods
An increase in the real interest rate
An increase in corporate profits
An increase in real gross domestic product

QuestionStatement: If a reduction in aggregate supply is followed by an increase in aggregate demand, which of the following will definitely occur?
AnswerChoices: Output will increase
Output will decrease
Output will not change
The price level will increase
The price level will decrease

QuestionStatement: Which of the following combinations of changes in government spending and taxes is necessarily expansionary?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E

QuestionStatement: According to the short-run Phillips curve, lower inflation rates are associated with
AnswerChoices: Higher unemployment rates
Higher government spending
Larger budget deficits
Greater labor-force participation rates
Smaller labor-force participation rates
